Title: The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes
Description: In this prequel to the Hunger Games trilogy, Coriolanus Snow mentors a tribute in the 10th Hunger Games.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Title: The Downstairs Girl
Description: In 19th-century Atlanta, Jo Kuan works as a lady's maid while secretly penning a controversial advice column and attempting to learn the truth about her past.
Author: Stacey Lee

Title: Zara's Rules for Record-Breaking Fun
Description: When a new family moves in across the street, ten-and-three-quarters-year-old Zara Saleem decides that she must break a Guinness World Record to remain queen of her Maryland neighborhood.
Author: Hena Khan

Title: The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark
Description: Shakespeare's famous tragedy tells the story of a Danish prince who must decide whether or not to avenge his father's death. Read the full text here.
Author: William Shakespeare

Title: The Lesbiana's Guide to Catholic School
Description: Sixteen-year-old Yamilet Flores is a queer Mexican-American girl who navigates Catholic school and first love while learning to be authentic to herself.
Author: Sonora Reyes

Title: Why We Fly
Description: High school cheerleaders Eleanor and Chanel face a tumultuous senior year after their decision to kneel during the national anthem at the first football game of the season.
Author: Kimberly Jones

Title: Rebecca
Description: The young and naive narrator of this novel marries a wealthy widower and moves to his stately mansion, where she uncovers dark secrets about his first wife.
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Title: Pashmina
Description: In this graphic novel, a teen girl discovers a magical shawl and learns about her family's history in India.
Author: Nidhi Chanani

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Description: Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy instantly loathe one another when they first meet. Can they overcome their first impressions? Read the full text here.
Author: Jane Austen

Title: When I Was Puerto Rican
Description: In this memoir, Santiago details her childhood in Puerto Rico and her family's emigration to the United States.
Author: Esmeralda Santiago

Title: Measuring Up
Description: Cici enters a cooking contest in hopes of winning enough money to buy her grandmother a plane ticket from Taiwan to the U.S.
Author: Lily LaMotte

Title: El Deafo
Description: In this graphic memoir, Cece Bell chronicles the struggles and triumphs of growing up deaf. Learn these words from the award-winning book.
Author: Cece Bell

Title: Beloved
Description: Winner of the Pulitzer Prize, Morrison's novel tells the story of Sethe, a formerly enslaved woman who is haunted by her past.
Author: Toni Morrison

Title: Burn Down, Rise Up
Description: When people mysteriously disappear and her mother is attacked by an infectious patient, sixteen-year-old Raquel Celestin and her friends start an investigation that leads them to a dangerous game in the tunnels of the Bronx.
Author: Vincent Tirado

Title: The Mayor of Casterbridge
Description: Michael Henchard, the Mayor of Casterbridge, is a successful and well-respected merchant — but if his shadowy past is exposed, he could lose everything. Read the full texthere.
Author: Thomas Hardy

Title: 120 Words Every 10th Grader Should Know
Subtitle: Vocabulary You Need to Succeed
Description: By analyzing student data and commonly taught texts, Vocabulary.com has compiled this collection of essential vocabulary for students in 10th grade. Master high-frequency, high-utility words that you'll encounter across the curriculum.

Title: Shadowshaper
Description: When her Brooklyn neighborhood is threatened, Sierra must master and protect an ancestral form of magic called shadowshaping.
Author: Daniel José Older

Title: 150 Words Every 6th Grader Should Know How to Spell
Description: Vocabulary.com has compiled this collection of spelling words for students in 6th grade. Use the Spelling Bee with these lists to watch your spelling skills soar.

Title: Facing the Lion
Subtitle: Growing Up Maasai on the African Savanna
Description: In this memoir, Jospeh Lemosolai Lekuton recounts his experiences of growing up as a member of the Maasai tribe in Kenya and his journey to America for college.
Author: Joseph Lekuton

Title: The Tale of Despereaux
Description: For falling in love with a human princess, a mouse named Despereaux Tilling is sentenced to death in a rat-filled dungeon.
Author: Kate DiCamillo

Title: A Little Princess
Description: Ten-year-old Sara Crewe is treated like a princess at her boarding school. When her father dies unexpectedly in India, Sara must live in the attic and work as a maid and errand girl. With the help of her vivid imagination — and a mysterious benefactor — she learns to survive and thrive.
Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

Title: New Kid
Description: In this graphic novel, an African-American seventh grader struggles to fit in at his new private school.
Author: Jerry Craft

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: October, 2019
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Words Used in the News
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or just like learning, these are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: In the Footsteps of Crazy Horse
Description: Jimmy McClean takes a road trip with his grandfather and learns about his Lakota heritage.
Author: Joseph Marshall III

Title: Fish in a Tree
Description: In this novel, a dedicated teacher and new friendships help Ally understand and come to terms with her dyslexia — and to realize that there's no shame in being different.
Author: Lynda Mullaly Hunt

Title: So Far from the Bamboo Grove
Description: This semi-autobiographical novel recounts the story of a Japanese family attempting to flee Korea and return home at the end of World War II.
Author: Yoko Kawashima Watkins

Title: White Rose
Description: In this historical novel-in-verse, German teenager Sophie Scholl joins a secret resistance group called the White Rose in order to oppose the Nazi regime.
Author: Kip Wilson

Title: Beauty Queens
Description: When their plane crashes on a desert island, the fifty contestants of the Miss Teen Dream Pageant learn what it takes to survive the toughest challenge. Learn these words from Libba Bray's hilarious social satire.
Author: Libba Bray

Title: The Tipping Point
Description: How does a small idea become a global craze? In this work of nonfiction, Malcolm Gladwell analyzes how trends are set in motion.
Author: Malcolm Gladwell

Title: Mardi Gras
Description: French for "Fat Tuesday," Mardi Gras originated as a celebration of spring and evolved into an indulgent period often followed by fasting and sacrifice. Celebrate Mardi Gras by mastering this festive list of vocabulary and then you can, as they say in New Orleans, "laissez les bons temps rouler!"

Title: The Prince and The Pauper
Description: A young prince and a poor commoner look almost exactly alike, so they decide to switch places to discover how the other lives. Read the full text here.
Author: Mark Twain

Title: The Voice That Challenged a Nation
Subtitle: Marian Anderson and the Struggle for Equal Rights
Description: Freedman's meticulously researched biography of vocalist Marian Anderson contextualizes the singer's life within the broader movement for civil rights and equality.
Author: Russell Freedman

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: March 2025
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word's-eye view of what's happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you're a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Akata Witch
Description: Growing up in Nigeria, twelve-year-old Sunny feels like an outsider — but when she learns that she has magical powers, she must work with other magical children to defeat a powerful witch.
Author: Nnedi Okorafor

Title: Essential Election Season Vocabulary
Subtitle: Words for Making Sense of Politics and Elections
Description: Election season brings an onslaught of campaign ads and news stories full of buzzwords about voting and the political process. Knowing these words is fundamental to understanding democracy and to developing informed opinions about the issues voters face. Learn these terms and cast a vote for vocabulary!

Title: Outcasts United
Subtitle: The Story of a Refugee Soccer Team That Changed a Town
Description: This book tells the inspiring true story of Luma Mufleh, a Jordanian woman who quit her job in order to coach the Fugees, a soccer team of refugee boys.
Author: Warren St. John

Title: The Far Away Brothers
Subtitle: Two Teenage Immigrants Making a Life in America
Description: In this nonfiction account, adapted for young adults, twin brothers Ernesto and Raúl make a difficult journey from El Salvador to California in search of a new life.
Author: Lauren Markham

Title: Spooked
Subtitle: How a Radio Broadcast and The War of the Worlds Sparked the 1938 Invasion of America
Description: In 1938, Orson Welles performed a radio version of H.G. Wells's science fiction novel The War of the Worlds — and inadvertently sparked panic among listeners who believed they were tuned in to a real news broadcast about an alien invasion. This award-winning book tells the story behind the broadcast and explores the effects of false information in the media.
Author: Gail Jarrow

Title: Tumble
Description: In a small town in New Mexico, twelve-year-old Adela Ramírez wrestles with the decision to be adopted, especially when she finds out more about her biological father.
Author: Celia C. Pérez

Title: Sojourner Truth: Ain't I a Woman?
Description: This biography chronicles the life of Sojourner Truth, a woman who was born a slave, and who became the embodiment of the universal ideals of abolition and equality.
Author: Patricia McKissack

Title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
Description: First published in 1792, this essay argues that women should have access to the same educational opportunities afforded to men. Read the full text here.
Author: Mary Wollstonecraft

Title: 200 Words Every 12th Grader Should Know How to Spell
Description: Vocabulary.com has compiled this collection of spelling words for students in 12th grade. Use the Spelling Bee with these lists to watch your spelling skills soar.

Title: Better Nate Than Ever
Description: In this hilarious novel, 13-year-old Nate sneaks off to New York City to audition for a role in a Broadway play. Learn this list in which the vocabulary from the novel takes center stage. Break a leg!
Author: Tim Federle

Title: The Field Guide to the North American Teenager
Description: After relocating to Austin, Texas, a Canadian teenager attempts to make sense of American culture.
Author: Ben Philippe

Title: Letters from Rifka
Description: A young Jewish girl immigrates to America from Russia in the aftermath of World War I.
Author: Karen Hesse

Title: My Life as an Ice Cream Sandwich
Description: Science fiction fan Ebony-Grace struggles to adjust when she leaves her sheltered life in Huntsville, Alabama to spend the summer with her father in New York City.
Author: Ibi Zoboi

Title: Hooked on a Feeling
Description: You'll be shocked, amazed, and delighted when you check out this collection of words to describe emotions.

Title: A Tale of Two Cities
Description: Set in both London and Paris, this novel brings the French Revolution vividly to life. Read the full text here.
Author: Charles Dickens

Title: Hiroshima
Description: This novella tells the story of a young survivor of the bombing of Hiroshima, Japan.
Author: Laurence Yep

Title: Number the Stars
Description: During World War II, ten-year-old Annemarie Johansen and her family take part in a courageous effort to protect the Jewish citizens of Denmark from the Nazis.
Author: Lois Lowry

Title: Charles and Emma
Subtitle: The Darwins' Leap of Faith
Description: This biography explores Charles Darwin's relationship with his wife Emma, whose faith both challenged and influenced Darwin's theory of evolution.
Author: Deborah Heiligman

Title: A First Time for Everything
Description: In this graphic memoir, the author recounts the struggles of middle school and how a three-week European group trip transformed his life in positive ways at the age of thirteen.
Author: Dan Santat

Title: Behind the Beautiful Forevers
Subtitle: Life, Death, and Hope in a Mumbai Undercity
Description: This award-winning book chronicles the experiences of families living in an impoverished settlement in Mumbai, India.
Author: Katherine Boo

Title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
Description: In the first book of Jeff Kinney's popular series, Greg Heffley deals with the trials and tribulations of middle school.
Author: Jeff Kinney

Title: Great Expectations
Description: Pip's life is changed when an anonymous benefactor pays for an expensive education in London, but he quickly discovers that you can't escape who you really are. Read the full text here.
Author: Charles Dickens

Title: Words with 15 or More Letters
Description: Big Word Day is a playful celebration of linguistic complexity, encouraging word enthusiasts to revel in the delight of polysyllabic treasures and embrace the grandeur of lengthy lexicons. On this day, language lovers indulge in the art of articulation, exploring the labyrinthine depths of verbose vocabulary with gusto and wit. It's a whimsical ode to the majesty of words, where sesquipedalianism reigns supreme and syllables stretch to reach the stars.

Title: Steelheart
Description: In this first book of The Reckoners series, eighteen-year-old David Charleston looks for weaknesses in the supernaturally powerful Epics so that he can avenge the murder of his father and restore freedom to the city that used to be Chicago.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Title: Lord of the Flies
Description: When they are marooned on a deserted island, a group of schoolboys attempts to form a new society.
Author: William Golding

Title: A Game of Thrones
Description: Lord Ned Stark is summoned to serve as an advisor to the King of Westeros, setting in motion a sweeping saga of courtly intrigue, military battle, and fire-breathing dragons.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Title: In Memoriam 2022
Subtitle: Honoring Notable Figures We Lost This Year
Description: This collection is a tribute to some of those who passed in 2022, including influential figures in politics and entertainment. Each list includes words that appeared in that person's writing, interviews, and speeches as well words that others used to describe an aspect of their life.

Title: 120 Words Every 9th Grader Should Know
Subtitle: Vocabulary You Need to Succeed
Description: By analyzing student data and commonly taught texts, Vocabulary.com has compiled this collection of essential vocabulary for students in 9th grade. Master high-frequency, high-utility words that you'll encounter across the curriculum.

Title: The Martian Chronicles
Description: In this collection of interrelated narratives, Ray Bradbury imagines the gradual colonization of Mars by earthlings.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Title: A Mighty Long Way
Subtitle: My Journey to Justice at Little Rock Central High School
Description: In this memoir, Carlotta Walls LaNier recounts being one of the first black students to integrate Little Rock Central High School.
Author: Carlotta Walls LaNier

Title: An Abundance of Katherines
Description: After graduation, child prodigy Colin and his best friend Hassan go on a road trip and attempt to understand the nature of love.
Author: John Green

Title: Winger
Description: Andrew Smith's hilarious and irreverent novel follows fourteen-year-old Ryan Dean West as he attempts to navigate friendship, love, and rugby while at boarding school.
Author: Andrew Smith

Title: The Haunting of Hill House
Description: In this classic horror novel, four people experience supernatural phenomena when they stay at a mysterious mansion.
Author: Shirley Jackson

Title: Between Shades of Gray
Description: During World War II, a Lithuanian girl named Lina is detained by Soviet soldiers and taken to a work camp in Siberia, where she must fight to survive.
Author: Ruta Sepetys

Title: Pictures of Hollis Wood
Description: After many years in foster care, 12-year-old Hollis is determined to stay with her new caretaker, Josie — but she also misses the Regan family.
Author: Patricia Reilly Giff

Title: When You Were Everything
Description: Cleo tries to build new friendships while she mourns her relationship with her former best friend.
Author: Ashley Woodfolk

Title: Sheep
Description: Called many names by different people, a border collie longs for a loving home where he can herd sheep.
Author: Valerie Hobbs

Title: Emily of New Moon
Description: After the death of her father, Emily Starr moves to New Moon Farm to live with her aunts and cousin. Read the full text here.
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Title: Sugar Changed the World
Subtitle: A Story of Magic, Spice, Slavery, Freedom, and Science
Description: In this nonfiction account, Marc Aronson and Marina Budhos trace the not-so-sweet history of sugar and its role in the slave trade.
Author: Marc Aronson

Title: Flush
Description: While his father sits in jail for eco-terrorism, Noah sets out to prove that a casino boat is illegally polluting a local harbor.
Author: Carl Hiaasen

Title: Copper Sun
Description: An unflinching look at the brutality of the American slave trade, Draper's novel tells the story of Amari, a young African girl who is enslaved.
Author: Sharon M. Draper

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: January 2025
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: We Are Not Free
Description: During World War II, a group of Japanese-American teens and their families are incarcerated in an internment camp.
Author: Traci Chee

Title: Escape from Mr. Lemoncello's Library
Description: Kyle and eleven other kids get the chance to stay overnight in Mr. Lemoncello's new, high-tech library. The children must solve a series of puzzles in order to find a way out of the library and win an amazing prize.
Author: Chris Grabenstein

Title: Charlie Thorne and the Last Equation
Description: Fearing that a sinister group will get its hands on a powerful equation devised by Einstein, the CIA enlists a young genius to find the hidden equation first.
Author: Stuart Gibbs

Title: I Will Always Write Back
Subtitle: How One Letter Changed Two Lives
Description: In 1997, an American girl and a Zimbabwean boy became pen pals, ultimately developing a friendship that would change both of their lives. In this memoir, they tell their story.
Author: Caitlin Alifirenka

Title: American Panda
Description: College freshman Mei struggles to live up to her parents expectations and figure out what kind of future she truly wants.
Author: Gloria Chao

Title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
Description: This American classic chronicles the exploits of Huck and Jim: one is running away from an abusive father and the other is fleeing enslavement. Read the full text here.
Author: Mark Twain

Title: Muggie Maggie
Description: Third-grader Maggie Schultz decides she does not want to learn how to read and write cursive.
Author: Beverly Cleary

Title: The Most Beautiful Roof in the World
Subtitle: Exploring the Rainforest Canopy
Description: This nonfiction account follows Dr. Meg Lowman as she explores the rainforest.
Author: Kathryn Lasky

Title: Homegoing
Description: This powerful book examines the legacy of the slave trade as it follows the divergent paths of two sisters and their descendants from Africa to the United States.
Author: Yaa Gyasi

Title: Omar Rising
Description: In this companion novel to Amal Unbound, seventh grader Omar Ali, the first in his village to get into a prestigious boarding school in Pakistan, is determined to meet the academic and community service requirements to keep his scholarship.
Author: Aisha Saeed

Title: Ella Minnow Pea
Description: Eighteen-year-old Ella Minnow Pea fights to save her family, friends, and neighbors after the local government forbids the use certain letters of the alphabet in written and spoken communications.
Author: Mark Dunn

Title: Legend
Description: In Marie Lu's dystopian novel, a military prodigy and a street criminal uncover shocking secrets about their government. Learn these words that will make you a vocabulary legend.
Author: Marie Lu

Title: After the Shot Drops
Description: Bunny and Nasir's friendship is tested after Bunny receives an athletic scholarship to a new school.
Author: Randy Ribay

Title: Tuck Everlasting
Description: After meeting the Tucks, a family that is able to live forever after drinking from a magical spring, Winnie Foster questions whether immortality is a blessing or a curse.
Author: Natalie Babbitt

Title: Iveliz Explains It All
Description: Unable to share her troubled feelings with anyone, twelve-year-old Iveliz Margarita Snow Medina addresses her journal in poems that describe her life in Maryland.
Author: Andrea Beatriz Arango

Title: The Skin I'm In
Description: A new teacher helps Maleeka stand up to the classmates who bully her and feel comfortable in her own skin.
Author: Sharon G. Flake

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: October 2023
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Ruby Lost and Found
Description: While struggling to deal with the death of her grandfather and the separation from her friends, thirteen-year-old Ruby Chu decides to ditch school and ends up spending time in both detention and her grandmother's apartment in San Francisco's Chinatown.
Author: Christina Li

Title: The Season of Styx Malone
Description: During one action-packed summer, brothers Caleb and Bobby Gene team up with smooth schemer Styx Malone in an attempt to escape their small town.
Author: Kekla Magoon

Title: Barely Missing Everything
Description: Best friends Juan and JD are determined to achieve their dreams, but they must fight against prejudice and poverty and cope with difficult family secrets.
Author: Matt Mendez

Title: Doctor Faustus
Description: In this tragedy, a German doctor summons a devil named Mephistophilis and trades his soul for power. Read the full text here.
Author: Christopher Marlowe

Title: White Bird
Subtitle: A Wonder Story
Description: In this companion to Wonder, Julian's grandmother tells the story of her life in France during World War II.
Author: R.J. Palacio

Title: Ender's Game
Description: Ender Wiggin is a brilliant but lonely young strategist in a world where children are trained to defend humankind against alien attacks.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Title: Matched
Description: In this dystopian novel, seventeen-year-old Cassia Reyes begins to question the strict rules of the society in which she lives.
Author: Ally Condie

Title: X: A Novel
Description: Cowritten by one of Malcolm X's daughters, this novel presents a fictionalized account of the activist's troubled youth.
Author: Ilyasah Shabazz

Title: Promises to Keep
Subtitle: How Jackie Robinson Changed America
Description: Sharon Robinson, daughter of baseball legend Jackie Robinson, shares memories of and insights about her father.
Author: Sharon Robinson

Title: Momo Arashima Steals the Sword of the Wind
Description: This first book of the series introduces a twelve-year-old Californian who dreads the seventh-grade social scene, until the discovery that she is the daughter of a Shintō goddess who needs her help to fight demons on the Japanese Island of Mysteries.
Author: Misa Sugiura

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: April 2024
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: We the People
Subtitle: Word Roots for Citizens of the World
Description: This truly civilized collection will help you master word roots related to humanity and society, from civ (“citizen”) to soc (“ally”). Power to the people!

Title: Expository Writing
Description: Expository writing is writing that presents the reader with important research and information about a topic. This collection of vocabulary can help expose you to the key terms that provide the basis for good expository writing.

Title: Amari and the Night Brothers
Description: Amari Peters competes for a coveted spot at the Bureau of Supernatural Affairs while trying to solve the mystery of her brother's disappearance.
Author: B.B. Alston

Title: Wintry Mix
Subtitle: Words for the Darkest, Coldest Days of the Year
Description: Hunker down with these lists packed with a mix of pleasant parlance about light and coziness, as well as words for the worst of winter weather. We can’t think of a better way to fend off the winter doldrums and ring in the New Year than by adding some brrr-illiant new words to your vocabulary!

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Description: On his eleventh birthday, orphan Harry Potter learns the shocking truth: he's a wizard about to begin his education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Title: The Wide Words of Sports
Subtitle: Get Your Game On with These Sports-Related Vocab Words
Description: Want a winning vocabulary? Ace vocabulary from tennis, tackle words from football, knock it out of the park with baseball banter, and slam dunk with definitions of basketball terms.

Title: Miracle's Boys
Description: Lafayette and his brothers struggle to make it on their own in New York City.
Author: Jacqueline Woodson

Title: Determined to Stay
Subtitle: Palestinian Youth Fight for Their Village
Description: This nonfiction text details native populations' struggles against the brutal injustices of colonization by focusing primarily on the history of Silwan, a village in Palestine that has been controlled by the Roman and Ottoman Empires, England, Jordan, and Israel.
Author: Jody Sokolower

Title: Utopia
Description: In this 16th-century book, More imagines an ideal state. More coined the word utopia, which literally means "nowhere." Read the full text here.
Author: Thomas More

Title: Hurricane Child
Description: Born on the U.S. Virgin Islands during a hurricane, Caroline has always considered herself unlucky: she is bullied at school, her mother has disappeared, and, worst of all, she seems to be haunted by a spirit. But a new friendship will force Caroline to face her problems and perhaps turn her luck around.
Author: Kacen Callender

Title: Tracking Trash
Subtitle: Flotsam, Jetsam, and the Science of Ocean Motion
Description: This installment of the Scientists in the Field series explores how trash circulates and accumulates in the world's oceans.
Author: Loree Griffin Burns

Title: Dawn
Description: Elisha, a Holocaust survivor living in Palestine, joins a paramilitary group and is ordered to execute a British officer. As he waits for dawn, when the execution is to take place, he meditates on his life.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Title: Commonly Confused Words, Grades 9–10
Description: Commonly confused words are pairs or groups of words that share similar spellings or pronunciations but have different meanings or usages. This collection features commonly confused words that ninth- and tenth-grade students frequently encounter while reading or taking standardized tests.

Title: The Souls of Black Folk
Description: W.E.B. Du Bois explores the struggles and triumphs of generations of African Americans in this collection of essays. Read the full text here.
Author: W.E.B. Du Bois

Title: The Fault in Our Stars
Description: Teenagers Hazel Grace Lancaster and Augustus Waters form an intense bond when they meet in a cancer support group in Indiana.
Author: John Green

Title: Red Scarf Girl
Subtitle: A Memoir of the Cultural Revolution
Description: Ji-li Jiang lived a happy life in China until the Cultural Revolution of 1966. As political unrest and division swept the country, her father was imprisoned and her life was turned upside down. In this memoir, she provides a window into a transformative period in Chinese history.
Author: Ji-li Jiang

Title: Funeral Songs for Dying Girls
Description: Living in the Toronto cemetery where her father works and her mother is buried, sixteen-year-old Winifred Blight often wanders around the graves at night, which leads to the belief that they would be a good moneymaking addition to a haunted ghost tour.
Author: Cherie Dimaline

Title: Shadow and Bone
Description: In the first book of the Grishaverse trilogy, a soldier discovers she has magical powers and begins training with an elite military force.
Author: Leigh Bardugo

Title: The Double Helix
Subtitle: A Personal Account of the Discovery of the Structure of DNA
Description: Francis Crick and James Watson changed the world forever—and won a Nobel Prize—when they uncovered the structure of DNA. In this memoir, Watson reveals the story behind their discovery.
Author: James D. Watson

Title: Native Speaker
Description: Secret agent Henry Park is torn between his American identity and his Korean heritage.
Author: Chang-rae Lee

Title: Full of Beans
Description: After taking a new job to help out his family during the Great Depression, ten-year-old Beans Curry learns that some actions can have dire consequences.
Author: Jennifer L. Holm

Title: The Heart Is a Lonely Hunter
Description: In this classic novel, the lonely inhabitants of a small Georgia town find companionship with John Singer, who is deaf and mute.
Author: Carson McCullers

Title: Moby Dick
Description: After signing up as a sailor on the Pequod, Ishmael discovers that Captain Ahab, unlike his crew, does not hunt a whale to make money off its oil, but rather, to get revenge for his lost leg. Read the full text here.
Author: Herman Melville

Title: Civil Disobedience
Description: Originally published as "On the Duty of Disobedience" and based on an 1848 lecture, Thoreau's work is a civil libertarian classic. Questioning the authority of all governments, Thoreau especially challenges both the right of the state to tax him and the morality of a government that allows slavery.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: July 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Presidential Parlance
Subtitle: Inspiring and Thought-Provoking Words from U.S. Presidents
Description: These speeches by U.S. Presidents from Abraham Lincoln to Ronald Reagan introduced a number of enduring phrases—like “military-industrial complex” and “rugged individualism”—into the American lexicon. Explore our collection of pivotal presidential speeches and learn the words that captivated a nation.

Title: Society and Solitude
Description: In this collection of twelve essays, the leader of New England's transcendentalist movement shares his philosophical ideas on different aspects of mid-nineteenth-century life. Read the full text here.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Title: Adrift
Description: A summer job in a beach town turns into a nightmare for a teenage boy and his friends when they are swept out to sea in a stolen boat.
Author: Paul Griffin

Title: Amazing Animals
Description: Explore the world of animals with this collection of words that will make you go hog wild! From aardvarks to zebras, it's sure to be more fun than a barrel full of monkeys!

Title: Furia
Description: An Argentinian teenager keeps her success as a soccer player — and her dreams of attending college in North America — a secret from her family.
Author: Yamile Saied Méndez

Title: Paradise on Fire
Description: Haunted by the memories of a fire that killed her parents, fifteen-year old Addy must lead her friends to safety after encountering a forest fire during a summer wilderness program.
Author: Jewell Parker Rhodes

Title: Turtles All the Way Down
Description: Sixteen-year-old Aza investigates the disappearance of a local billionaire and navigates complicated relationships with her mom, best friend, and a new romantic interest, all while trying to manage obsessive-compulsive disorder.
Author: John Green

Title: African Town
Description: Told from different perspectives, this novel-in-verse was inspired by the true story of the ship Clotilda, which transported West Africans from Dahomey to Mobile, Alabama, where the slaves emancipated after the Civil War founded their own town.
Author: Irene Latham

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: January 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Essential Word Roots
Subtitle: A Garden of Resources for Budding Etymologists
Description: Grow your vocabulary by mastering the most common Greek and Latin word roots used in English. Our essential collection covers everything from amb (“walk”) to tor (“twist”).

Title: The Lost City of Z
Subtitle: A Tale of Deadly Obsession in the Amazon
Description: This nonfiction narrative traces the journey of the author through the Amazon to investigate the 1925 disappearance of the British explorer Percy Harrison Fawcett, who was on a quest to prove the existence of an ancient civilization within a harsh environment.
Author: David Grann

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: April 2020
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Words Used in the News
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Under a Painted Sky
Description: When 15-year-old Samantha, a Chinese-American girl living in Missouri in the mid-19th-century, finds herself on the wrong side of the law, she and her best friend embark on a journey westward, following the Oregon Trail.
Author: Stacey Lee

Title: Grown
Description: An aspiring singer must prove she didn't murder the R&B star who took her under his wing.
Author: Tiffany D. Jackson

Title: A Raisin in the Sun
Description: In the 1940s, a working class African-American family in Chicago must decide how to best spend a ten-thousand dollar insurance payout.
Author: Lorraine Hansberry

Title: Parachutes
Description: Claire's parents send her from China to California to live with a host family and attend an American high school.
Author: Kelly Yang

Title: The Shining
Description: In this classic horror novel, Jack Torrance takes a job as a caretaker at the Overlook Hotel, where he and his family are tormented by the hotel's haunting influence.
Author: Stephen King

Title: The Breadwinner
Description: Living in Afghanistan under Taliban rule, eleven-year-old Parvana must disguise herself as a boy in order to earn money for her family.
Author: Deborah Ellis

Title: The Story of My Life
Description: This account of Helen Keller's life is divided into three parts: Part I is Keller's autobiography, which she published in 1903; Part II is a selection of Keller's letters; and Part III consists of supplementary materials by Keller's teacher and lifelong friend, Anne Sullivan.
Author: Helen Keller

Title: Enrique's Journey
Description: Enrique's mother left Honduras to find work in the United States; eleven years later, Enrique embarked on a dangerous journey to reunite with her. In this powerful nonfiction account, journalist Sonia Nazario recounts his experiences.
Author: Sonia Nazario

Title: You Are Here: Connecting Flights
Description: This collection of twelve stories by different authors is set in the Chicago Gateway International Airport, where tween characters are experiencing delays and encounters colored by their Asian American heritage.
Author: Ellen Oh

Title: Neighborhood Odes
Description: This poetry collection celebrates the ordinary events and everyday objects that make a neighborhood special.
Author: Gary Soto

Title: Gone Crazy in Alabama
Description: When sisters Delphine, Vonetta, and Fern visit relatives in Alabama, they find themselves in the middle of an unexpected family feud. Learn these words from the last book in the Gaither Sisters trilogy.
Author: Rita Williams-Garcia

Title: We Dream of Space
Description: Set in 1986, this novel traces the ups and downs of three siblings as they wait for the launch of the Challenger space shuttle.
Author: Erin Entrada Kelly

Title: Bud, Not Buddy
Description: During the Great Depression, a ten-year-old boy hits the road in search of the father he has never known.
Author: Christopher Paul Curtis

Title: Brian's Winter
Description: This sequel to Hatchet and The River imagines that 13-year-old Brian Robeson wasn't rescued the summer after he survived a plane crash and had to survive the winter in the Canadian wilderness on his own.
Author: Gary Paulsen

Title: The Beauty That Remains
Description: After suffering painful losses, three teens find solace in music — and each other.
Author: Ashley Woodfolk

Title: Silent Spring
Description: This groundbreaking book, published in the early 1960s, investigated the devastating effects of chemical pesticides on the environment. Carson's work is credited with helping to create the Environmental Protection Agency.
Author: Rachel Carson

Title: Black Beauty
Description: Anna Sewell's classic novel tells the life story of a horse who experiences both hardship and kindness.
Author: Anna Sewell

Title: The Secret Life of Bees
Description: In South Carolina, a girl reckons with her mother's death while under the care of three sisters.
Author: Sue Monk Kidd

Title: Every Body Looking
Description: As Ada begins college and looks toward the future, she also needs to come to terms with her past.
Author: Candice Iloh

Title: The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
Description: In this novel, a boy imprisoned in a concentration camp and the son of a Nazi commandant develop an unlikely friendship.
Author: John Boyne

Title: Arms and the Man
Description: After the Serbo-Bulgarian War, a young woman is torn between her war hero fiancé and a Swiss mercenary.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Title: Sounder
Description: In this powerful and heart-wrenching book, a sharecropper's family, including devoted dog Sounder, struggles to survive.
Author: William H. Armstrong

Title: In the Time of the Butterflies
Description: Based on the historical Mirabal sisters, this is a fictionalized account of why and how they decide to fight dictator Rafael Trujillo's oppressive regime in the Dominican Republic.
Author: Julia Alvarez

Title: The Probability of Everything
Description: Eleven-year-old Kemi Carter is an aspiring scientist who loves the predictability of statistics, especially when she cannot control what's happening to her life in Michigan.
Author: Sarah Everett

Title: Tristan Strong Punches a Hole in the Sky
Description: After the death of his best friend, grieving seventh-grader Tristan Strong goes to Alabama to spend a month with his grandparents. There, he accidentally opens a portal to a world populated by African gods and African-American folk heroes.
Author: Kwame Mbalia

Title: Let the Circle Be Unbroken
Description: In this sequel to Roll of Thunder, Hear My Cry, the Logans support a friend accused of a crime he didn't commit and confront prejudice and greed in their neighborhood.
Author: Mildred D. Taylor

Title: Amina's Song
Description: A sequel to Amina's Voice, this novel follows Amina as she tries to help her friends understand the beauty of Pakistan after her presentation on Malala Yousafzai goes awry.
Author: Hena Khan

Title: Kaffir Boy
Subtitle: An Autobiography – The True Story of a Black Youth's Coming of Age in Apartheid South Africa
Description: Growing up in South Africa under apartheid, Mark Mathabane and his siblings struggled to survive in an impoverished ghetto. In this memoir, he describes how education and a talent for tennis helped him to escape the poverty and violence of his childhood.
Author: Mark Mathabane

Title: Unbroken
Description: Laura Hillenbrand recounts the tumultuous and amazingly true story of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic runner who, after surviving 40 days adrift at sea, became a prisoner of war in Japan during World War II.
Author: Laura Hillenbrand

Title: The Cost of Knowing
Description: Following his parents' death, Alex discovers that he has the ability to see the future. After seeing his brother's impending death, Alex's world is turned upside down as he tries to change the future and save his brother.
Author: Brittney Morris

Title: Typical American
Description: Forced to stay in the United States after the Communist takeover of China, Ralph Chang and his sister Theresa are torn between retaining their cultural traditions and assimilating into their new home.
Author: Gish Jen

Title: The Forgotten Girl
Description: Eleven-year-old best friends Iris Rose and Daniel Stone research the mystery of an abandoned graveyard in a small North Carolina town.
Author: India Hill Brown

Title: The Boys Who Challenged Hitler
Subtitle: Knud Pedersen and the Churchill Club
Description: In 1940, a group of Danish teens formed a secret resistance group called the Churchill Club in order to oppose the Nazi regime. In this nonfiction account, Phillip Hoose traces the development and accomplishments of the club.
Author: Phillip Hoose

Title: The Last Last-Day-of-Summer
Description: Cousins Otto and Sheed, also known as the Legendary Alston Boys, are used to dealing with unusual happenings in the town of Fry, Virginia. When a mysterious stranger freezes time on the last day of summer vacation, the young sleuths embark on their strangest and most dangerous adventure yet.
Author: Lamar Giles

Title: Self-Made Boys
Description: Based on the classic novel The Great Gatsby, this work follows the story of Nicolás Caraveo, a seventeen-year-old transgender boy who moves to New York and meets his mysterious neighbor Jay Gatsby, another transgender boy with an extravagant and decadent lifestyle.
Author: Anna-Marie McLemore

Title: The Color Purple
Description: In letters to God and each other, two sisters, Celie and Nettie, share the details of their trouble-filled lives in the American South and Africa.
Author: Alice Walker

Title: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat
Subtitle: And Other Clinical Tales
Description: In this classic collection of "clinical tales," neurologist Oliver Sacks explores a range of neurological conditions and phenomena.
Author: Oliver Sacks

Title: Amendments to the U.S. Constitution
Description: Improve your understanding of American history by learning these terms from the Bill of Rights and other amendments to the U.S. Constitution.

Title: A Pinch of Magic
Description: In this first book of the series, thirteen-year-old Betty Widdershin, with her sisters Felicity and Charlotte, must figure out how to use their inherited magical objects to reverse an ancient family curse that does not allow them to leave the island of Crowstone.
Author: Michelle Harrison

Title: 125 Words Every 7th Grader Should Know
Subtitle: Vocabulary You Need to Succeed
Description: By analyzing student data and commonly taught texts, Vocabulary.com has compiled this collection of essential vocabulary for students in 7th grade. Master high-frequency, high-utility words that you'll encounter across the curriculum.

Title: Tangerine
Description: Soccer goalie Paul Fisher uncovers dark family secrets when he moves to the strange town of Tangerine, Florida.
Author: Edward Bloor

Title: Crime and Punishment
Description: A classic of Russian literature, this novel explores the psyche of a poor young man who plots to murder and rob a wealthy pawnbroker. Read the full text here.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Title: Drowned City: Hurricane Katrina & New Orleans
Description: This acclaimed nonfiction book tells the story of Hurricane Katrina in graphic form.
Author: Don Brown

Title: Gods, Heroes and Men of Ancient Greece
Subtitle: Mythology's Great Tales of Valor and Romance
Description: In this collection, W.H.D. Rouse retells ancient myths and legends from classical Greece.
Author: W.H.D. Rouse

Title: Katt Loves Dogg
Description: In this sequel to Katt vs. Dogg, Molly and Oscar, former enemies turned best friends, work together to find their missing cousins and unite different species.
Author: James Patterson

Title: The Hate U Give
Description: In this best-selling novel, sixteen-year-old Starr's life is turned upside down when she witnesses the death of her friend Khalil at the hands of a police officer.
Author: Angie Thomas

Title: Lotus Bloom and the Afro Revolution
Description: Lotus Bloom, a seventh-grade girl who loves the vintage style of the 1970s, learns to speak up and fight for the freedom of expression after facing a dress code violation at school.
Author: Sherri Winston

Title: The Nickel Boys
Description: This Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, based on historical events, traces the harrowing story of two boys sent to a Florida reformatory school in the 1960s.
Author: Colson Whitehead

Title: The Mona Lisa Vanishes
Subtitle: A Legendary Painter, a Shocking Heist, and the Birth of a Global Celebrity
Description: This nonfiction narrative traces how Leonardo da Vinci's 16th-century painting of an ordinary Italian wife and mother became the most recognizable face in the world.
Author: Nicholas Day

Title: Charlie Hernández & the League of Shadows
Description: Charlie learns that the supposedly mythical creatures from Hispanic folklore are real and finds himself caught in an epic supernatural battle.
Author: Ryan Calejo

Title: When Zachary Beaver Came to Town
Description: In this coming-of-age story, a thirteen-year-old boy learns about loss and friendship over the course of one eventful summer.
Author: Kimberly Willis Holt

Title: All the Bright Places
Description: Two teenagers in crisis offer each other unexpected support—but while Finch helps Violet heal from trauma, his own life is falling apart.
Author: Jennifer Niven

Title: Crush
Description: The third installment of the Berrybrook Middle School series follows Jorge Ruiz as he tries to navigate his first crush.
Author: Svetlana Chmakova

Title: The ACT Reading Test: Multiple-Meaning Words
Description: On the ACT Reading Test, you'll encounter questions that ask you to determine the meanings of common words in context. We've identified 200 high-frequency, multiple-meaning words of the sort that you'll see on the exam. As you practice this list, you'll have to rely on context clues in order to determine each word’s meaning in a particular sentence. Be careful! Several of a word's meanings might show up as answer choices — but only one answer will capture the meaning of the word in the context of the sentence.

Title: Mexikid
Description: In this graphic memoir Pedro/Peter Martín recounts the summer when his big family took a road trip to Mexico to tighten loose ends and bring his legendary, bandit-fighting Abuelito to live with them in California.
Author: Pedro Martín

Title: Night
Description: In this unflinching memoir, Elie Wiesel describes his experience as a young man imprisoned in a Nazi concentration camp during the Holocaust.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants
Description: A pair of magical jeans helps four best friends feel close even when they can't be together.
Author: Ann Brashares

Title: Seedfolks
Description: Author Paul Fleischman coined the term seedfolks to describe ordinary people whose lives are connected by a community garden.
Author: Paul Fleischman

Title: I Am Malala
Subtitle: Young Readers Edition
Description: An ordinary Pakistani girl is shot by the Taliban while fighting for her right to an education. Co-written with Patricia McCormick, in this memoir, Malala Yousafzai, the youngest winner of the Nobel Peace Prize, tells her story.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Title: Idioms and Expressions
Description: Cat got your tongue? Then take the bull by the horns and dive into this collection of common English idioms and expressions. With Vocabulary.com, word mastery is a piece of cake!

Title: Willodeen
Description: After a birthday gift brings magic to eleven-year-old Willodeen and her friend Connor, Willodeen goes on a mission to protect her favorite strange beasts known as screechers.
Author: Katherine Applegate

Title: Miracles on Maple Hill
Description: Marly's family moves to the country to help her father, a World War II veteran, find peace and joy.
Author: Virginia Sorensen

Title: Shiloh
Description: This Newbery Medal-winning novel tells the story of a boy's efforts to protect a beloved dog from abuse.
Author: Phyllis Reynolds Naylor

Title: Kings of B'More
Description: When sixteen-year-old Harrison Meredith finds out that his best friend Linus Munro is moving away, he plans a surprise day of adventures.
Author: R. Eric Thomas

Title: Between the World and Me
Description: Framed as a letter to his teenaged son, Coates's book is a profound meditation on race in American culture. Learn these words from the National Book Award winner.
Author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

Title: Out of the Dust
Description: Written in free verse, this Newbery Medal-winning novel details the struggles of an Oklahoman teenager during the dust-filled years of the Great Depression.
Author: Karen Hesse

Title: Culture and Society
Description: Whether you're writing about people, talking about your work, or reading passages about life in the city, you'll need a strong vocabulary related to culture and society to succeed on the IELTS exam. This vocabulary collection will help you learn terms related to food, art, entertainment and more. Brush up on this collection and navigate the reading, writing, speaking, and listening sections of the test with confidence.

Title: Absolutely Almost
Description: Having almost done this and almost been that his whole life in New York City, fifth-grader Albin Schaffhauser wants to figure out what he’s actually worth.
Author: Lisa Graff

Title: Kim
Description: This novel recounts the adventures of an Irish orphan in India in the late 19th century.
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Title: In Like a Lion, Out Like a Lamb
Subtitle: Explore these Lists from the March Calendar
Description: March is a turning point in the calendar, when winter ends and spring begins. It’s also full of word-worthy events, like Pi Day, Saint Patrick’s Day, National Fragrance Day, and March Madness.

Title: War Brothers
Description: Based on true events, this graphic novel tells the harrowing story of a boy forced to be a child soldier in Uganda.
Author: Sharon E. McKay

Title: Ugly
Description: Born with a large tumor on his face, Hoge survived multiple surgeries — but faced bullying and cruelty because of his atypical appearance. In this memoir, Hoge recounts how he learned to embrace his differences.
Author: Robert Hoge

Title: The Magic Fish
Description: This graphic novel weaves fairy tales into the story of a Vietnamese-American boy struggling to communicate with his parents.
Author: Trung Le Nguyen

Title: Drama High
Description: This account of teacher Lou Volpe, who built a renowned high school theater program in a struggling town, was written by one of Volpe's former students.
Author: Michael Sokolove

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: June 2023
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Common Senses
Subtitle: Sense-ational Word Roots
Description: Now hear this! Come to your senses and master words related to seeing, hearing, and touching. You’ll get a taste for roots like aud, phon, tact, and vid.

Title: The School Story
Description: A twelve-year-old girl poses as a literary agent in order to get her best friend's novel published.
Author: Andrew Clements

Title: 5th Grade World Cuisine
Description: Sink your teeth into this vocabulary list and learning about world cuisine will be a piece of cake. You'll get a taste of international foods like baklava and bratwurst, guacamole and gumbo, pita and polenta. This list is so delicious that you'll want to eat your words!

Title: An Indigenous Peoples' History of the United States
Subtitle: For Young People
Description: This award-winning book traces the history of indigenous peoples before, during, and after the founding of the United States of America.
Author: Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz

Title: Johnny Tremain
Description: The year is 1773, and fourteen-year-old Johnny is an apprentice silversmith in Boston. When a terrible accident threatens his future, Johnny must quickly adapt — just as the American colonists join forces to break free from British rule.
Author: Esther Forbes

Title: Lifting as We Climb
Subtitle: Black Women's Battle for the Ballot Box
Description: This book explores the achievements of black women in the American suffrage movement.
Author: Evette Dionne

Title: Becoming Kareem
Subtitle: Growing Up On and Off the Court
Description: In this memoir, basketball star Kareem Abdul-Jabar recounts his youth and traces his path to the NBA.
Author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

Title: The Silence Between Us
Description: Maya, a Deaf teenager, tries to adjust to her new school after moving across the country.
Author: Alison Gervais

Title: Ruby Holler
Description: Twins Dallas and Florida have been in and out of foster homes their entire lives—will they be able to trust their unconventional new guardians and find a home in Ruby Holler?
Author: Sharon Creech

Title: The Smartest Kid in the Universe
Description: After twelve-year-old Jake accidentally eats ingestible information pills that he mistakes for jelly beans, he becomes the smartest kid in the world and must use his new brain power to help save his middle school from the evil vice principals' dastardly plot.
Author: Chris Grabenstein

Title: Locomotion
Description: In this verse novel, eleven-year-old Lonnie reflects on his life in foster care.
Author: Jacqueline Woodson

Title: for colored girls who have considered suicide / when the rainbow is enuf
Description: In Shange's groundbreaking "choreopoem," a series of African-American women, identified only by the colors they wear, deliver monologues about their lives.
Author: Ntozake Shange

Title: Patron Saints of Nothing
Description: High school senior Jay Reguero travels to the Philippines to investigate his cousin's murder — and grapples with his identity as a Filipino American.
Author: Randy Ribay

Title: The Bell Jar
Description: This semi-autobiographical novel chronicles a young woman's struggle with depression.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Title: The Magical Imperfect
Description: In a small California town, twelve-year-old Etan Hirsch has trouble talking when his life is shaken by earthquakes and the hospitalization of his mother.
Author: Chris Baron

Title: Our America
Subtitle: Life and Death on the South Side of Chicago
Description: Two young men share their experiences growing up in a Chicago housing project.
Author: LeAlan Jones

Title: Speak
Description: After calling the police during an end-of-summer party, Melinda is an outcast at school. How can Melinda tell the truth about what really happened when she won't even speak?
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson

Title: Solito: A Memoir
Description: In this memoir, the author recounts how as a nine-year-old, he migrated from El Salvador to reunite with his parents in California.
Author: Javier Zamora

Title: Mrs. Frisby and the Rats of NIMH
Description: Mrs. Frisby and her children, a family of mice, must leave their home in order to escape the farmer's plow. Because her son Timothy is too sick to leave his bed, Mrs. Frisby enlists the help of a group of super-intelligent rats to help move her family to safety.
Author: Robert C. O'Brien

Title: Howards End
Description: This classic novel explores social class and conventions in early 20th-century England. Read the full text here.
Author: E.M. Forster

Title: The Lightning Thief
Subtitle: Percy Jackson and the Olympians, Book 1
Description: Percy Jackson's normal life is turned upside down when gods from Greek mythology accuse him of stealing a supernatural weapon. Percy must find the real thief — and figure out his connection to the gods.
Author: Rick Riordan

Title: Dream, Annie, Dream
Description: At a summer theater camp in Kansas, twelve-year-old Aoi Inoue decides to change her name to Annie Enoway, hoping that it would be the first step towards star-filled accomplishments.
Author: Waka T. Brown

Title: Ronit and Jamil
Description: In this verse novel based on Romeo and Juliet, Ronit and Jamil are star-crossed lovers who try to overcome geographical and familial barriers in Israel and Palestine.
Author: Pamela Laskin

Title: A Wizard of Earthsea
Description: In this fantasy novel, a young and powerful wizard named Ged must defeat a dark creature of his own creation.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Title: The Love Collection
Subtitle: Words to Love By
Description: Do you have a soft spot for romance? Or are you a cynic when it comes to love? Either way, you’ll be smitten with the love-ly lists we’ve collected in honor of Valentine’s Day.

Title: Symphony for the City of the Dead
Subtitle: Dmitri Shostakovich and the Siege of Leningrad
Description: In 1941, composer Dmitri Shostakovich wrote a symphony in response to the relentless Siege of Leningrad. M.T. Anderson explores both the siege and Shostakovich's work in this award-winning nonfiction account.
Author: M.T. Anderson

Title: New From Here
Description: Moving back to California from Hong Kong, ten-year-old Knox, his older brother Bowen, and younger sister Lea, must deal not only with the coronavirus but also the separation from their father and fearful suspicions of their background.
Author: Kelly Yang

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: May 2020
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Words Used in the News
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Hey, Kiddo
Description: Author and artist Jarrett J. Krosoczka, the creator of the Lunch Lady graphic novels, was raised by his grandparents due to his mother's struggles with addiction. In this memoir, he recounts growing up in a complicated and sometimes troubled family.
Author: Jarrett J. Krosoczka

Title: Ash
Description: Ash is under the thumb of a heartless stepmother and torn between a promise to the menacing fairy Sidhean and her feelings for Kaisa, the king's huntress. Learn these words from Malinda Lo's lyrical retelling of the Cinderella story.
Author: Malinda Lo

Title: Writing in the Classroom: Middle School
Description: Have you got the write stuff? Find out by exploring this comprehensive collection of words related to writing. You'll review genres of writing, text structure, grammar and parts of speech, stages of the writing process, and much more. From introduction to conclusion, this list has got you covered.

Title: Primates
Subtitle: The Fearless Science of Jane Goodall, Dian Fossey, and Biruté Galdikas
Description: Using a graphic novel format, this book explores the lives and work of primatologists Jane Goodall, Dian Fossey, and Biruté Galdikas.
Author: Jim Ottaviani

Title: Essential Science Vocabulary
Description: Whether you want to brush up on biology, study space science, or prep for a physics test, this collection of science vocabulary is for you! Our lists cover essential terms and concepts from all major scientific disciplines.

Title: Don't Want to Be Your Monster
Description: Foster brothers in a family created by two vampires, ten-year-old Adam and fourteen-year-old Victor discover there's a murderer in their Washington town, but they respond in different ways to the violent spilling of blood.
Author: Deke Moulton

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: June 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: March: Book Three
Description: Written with Andrew Aydin and illustrated by Nate Powell, Congressman John Lewis's award-winning graphic novel chronicles his experiences in the U.S. Civil Rights Movement.
Author: John Lewis

Title: Laura Dean Keeps Breaking Up with Me
Description: In this award-winning graphic novel, Freddy struggles to break free from an unhealthy relationship.
Author: Mariko Tamaki

Title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
Subtitle: As Told to Alex Haley
Description: In this powerful memoir, Malcolm X describes the development of his revolutionary consciousness and his transformation into an influential activist and leader.
Author: Malcolm X

Title: The Boy on the Wooden Box
Subtitle: How the Impossible Became Possible...on Schindler's List
Description: In this memoir, Leyson details how he and his family survived the Holocaust with the help of Oskar Schindler.
Author: Leon Leyson

Title: Chasing Lincoln's Killer
Description: Using trial manuscripts, archival materials, and interviews following President Abraham Lincoln's assassination, Swanson details the wild twelve-day chase to capture John Wilkes Booth.
Author: James L. Swanson

Title: Enchanted Air
Subtitle: Two Cultures, Two Wings
Description: In this memoir, poet Margarita Engle recounts her childhood in Cuba and the United States during the Cold War.
Author: Margarita Engle

Title: The Friendship War
Description: When sixth-grader Grace inspires a new craze for collecting buttons at her school, she inadvertently starts a war with her best friend.
Author: Andrew Clements

Title: All Thirteen
Subtitle: The Incredible Cave Rescue of the Thai Boys' Soccer Team
Description: This award-winning nonfiction book details the rescue of twelve soccer players and their coach from a flooded cave in Thailand.
Author: Christina Soontornvat

Title: Nickel and Dimed
Subtitle: On (Not) Getting By in America
Description: In this exposé, the journalist goes undercover to learn about the struggles of low-wage workers in the United States.
Author: Barbara Ehrenreich

Title: The Giver
Description: Twelve-year-old Jonas lives in a regimented community that is free from pain and suffering — but also free from joy, independence, and even color. When he is appointed the community's Receiver of Memory, Jonas begins to question everything he has been taught.
Author: Lois Lowry

Title: The Hot Zone
Subtitle: The Terrifying True Story of the Origins of the Ebola Virus
Description: In this riveting nonfiction account, Richard Preston traces the emergence and spread of the deadly Ebola virus.
Author: Richard Preston

Title: Peter Pan
Description: In this classic novel, Peter Pan brings three children — Wendy, Michael, and John — to Neverland and tries to outwit his nemesis, Captain Hook.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Title: Pelé
Subtitle: The King of Soccer
Description: This biography, told in graphic form, explores the life of the famed Brazilian soccer player.
Author: Eddy Simon

Title: 200 Words Every 10th Grader Should Know How to Spell
Description: Vocabulary.com has compiled this collection of spelling words for students in 10th grade. Use the Spelling Bee with these lists to watch your spelling skills soar.

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: September 2023
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: The Strangers
Subtitle: Greystone Secrets, Book 1
Description: Chess, Natalie, and Finn Greystone attempt to find their missing mother and three kidnapped children.
Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix

Title: The GED Science Test
Description: Master the science of GED prep! Our vocabulary lists will help reinforce your understanding of the major topics covered on the GED Science Test, including the scientific method, life science, physical science, earth science, and more. Learn these essential terms to improve your test score and your confidence.

Title: In the Year of the Boar and Jackie Robinson
Description: After she moves to New York City from China, Shirley struggles to fit in and make friends — until she discovers baseball.
Author: Bette Bao Lord

Title: The Shakespeare Stealer
Description: This novel, set in Elizabethan England, tells the story of an orphan boy who attempts to steal a copy of Shakespeare's Hamlet.
Author: Gary Blackwood

Title: Goodbye Stranger
Description: Bridge, Emily, and Tab are best friends who make a promise never to fight – but when seventh grade arrives, keeping their promise is more difficult than they expected.
Author: Rebecca Stead

Title: Redemptor
Description: In this sequel to Raybearer, seventeen-year-old Tarisai Kunleo, as the Empress of Aritsar, makes a deal with demons to stop the annual sacrifices of two hundred children.
Author: Jordan Ifueko

Title: Ties That Bind, Ties That Break
Description: In this historical novel, an upper-class Chinese girl refuses to have her feet bound and must face the social consequences of her decision.
Author: Lensey Namioka

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: September 2024
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: March: Book Two
Description: Written with Andrew Aydin and illustrated by Nate Powell, Congressman John Lewis's award-winning graphic novel chronicles his experiences in the U.S. Civil Rights Movement.
Author: John Lewis

Title: Pax, Journey Home
Description: Pax, a fox, reunites with Peter, the boy who once cared for him, though both are struggling in the aftermath of war.
Author: Sara Pennypacker

Title: A Christmas Carol
Description: On Christmas Eve, cruel penny-pincher Ebenezer Scrooge is visited by three spirits who show him visions of his past, present, and future. Read the full text here.
Author: Charles Dickens

Title: The Phantom Tollbooth
Description: In this novel filled with wordplay, the eternally bored Milo travels to the Lands Beyond and embarks on a quest to rescue Rhyme and Reason. Learn these words from Norton Juster's beloved classic.
Author: Norton Juster

Title: English Vocabulary Derived from French
Description: Bonjour, vocabulary connoisseurs! Did you know that almost 30% of words in the English language come from French? Brush up on these common English words derived from French and show everyone that your vocabulary is the crème de la crème.

Title: Across Five Aprils
Description: Jethro Creighton lives on a farm in southern Illinois when the Civil War begins. As he comes of age, the war impacts his family in ways he never could have imagined.
Author: Irene Hunt

Title: Ghost Boys
Description: In this thought-provoking exploration of bias and injustice, a twelve-year-old boy meets the ghost of Emmett Till (an African-American teen who was lynched in 1955) in the afterlife.
Author: Jewell Parker Rhodes

Title: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child
Description: Harry Potter now has children of his own, but when his son Albus begins school at Hogwarts, it seems that the past is returning to haunt them both.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Title: In Cold Blood
Description: In a groundbreaking work of nonfiction, Truman Capote investigates the brutal murder of a small-town Kansas family and the trial of the killers.
Author: Truman Capote

Title: Anything But Typical
Description: A twelve-year-old boy with autism strikes up an online friendship but worries about meeting his new friend in person.
Author: Nora Raleigh Baskin

Title: Far from the Tree
Description: In this National Book Award-winning novel, three siblings raised in different households attempt to forge relationships with one another.
Author: Robin Benway

Title: Orphan Island
Description: A group of children live happily on an idyllic island — but once a year, a boat takes the oldest child away and brings a new child to the island. Jinny, now the eldest, must care for the new arrival while preparing for the day when she must leave.
Author: Laurel Snyder

Title: The Things They Carried
Description: A series of linked stories explores the lifelong effects of trauma on a platoon of soldiers during and after the Vietnam War.
Author: Tim O'Brien

Title: The Sea in Winter
Description: After a knee injury dashes her dreams of becoming a ballerina, twelve-year-old Maisie struggles with recovery during a midwinter family road trip.
Author: Christine Day

Title: Geology Rocks!
Subtitle: Mine This Collection of Earthy Words
Description: If you’re at a loss for words when it comes to describing the amazing features of our awe-inspiring planet, then dig into these lists. They’re packed with terrestrial terms that describe the geological wonders of the world.

Title: The Outsiders
Description: In the 1960s, tensions between two rival gangs separated along economic lines reach a violent breaking point.
Author: S.E. Hinton

Title: Nevermoor
Subtitle: The Trials of Morrigan Crow
Description: Eleven-year-old Morrigan Crow escapes a curse by traveling to the magical city of Nevermoor, where she must compete for a place in the exclusive Wundrous Society.
Author: Jessica Townsend

Title: Ikenga
Description: In Kaleria, Nigeria, twelve-year-old Nnamdi is on a mission to avenge his father's death with the help of his best friend and newly acquired supernatural powers.
Author: Nnedi Okorafor

Title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
Subtitle: Or Gustavus Vassa, The African
Description: In this autobiography, first published in 1789, Olaudah Equiano recounts his life as an enslaved person and then as a free man.
Author: Olaudah Equiano

Title: A Face for Picasso
Subtitle: Coming of Age with Crouzon Syndrome
Description: In this memoir, the author reveals how she and her twin sister survived the physical and emotional effects of a rare disfiguring condition called Crouzon Syndrome.
Author: Ariel Henley

Title: Stella by Starlight
Description: In this historical novel, a young girl confronts prejudice and injustice in her segregated North Carolina town.
Author: Sharon M. Draper

Title: Almost American Girl
Description: In this memoir, told in graphic form, Robin Ha recounts her experiences as a young immigrant from South Korea.
Author: Robin Ha

Title: The Jungle
Description: Published in 1906, this novel helped expose the oppressive and unsafe labor conditions in Chicago's meatpacking industry.
Author: Upton Sinclair

Title: Moneyball
Subtitle: The Art of Winning an Unfair Game
Description: This nonfiction book explores how the manager of the Oakland A's built a high-performing team by using a unique set of criteria to assess prospective players.
Author: Michael Lewis

Title: American Government and Civics
Description: We the people at Vocabulary.com, in order to form a more perfect lexicon, establish this collection of words associated with U.S. citizenship. You'll review the structure of the American government, elections, juries, and more as you explore the rights and responsibilities of American citizens.

Title: The Beatles
Description: The Beatles revolutionized the world of music with their groundbreaking contributions, leaving an indelible mark on popular culture. As pioneers of the British Invasion, they introduced a fresh sound that blended rock 'n' roll, pop, and elements of various genres. Their songwriting prowess, led by the iconic duo of John Lennon and Paul McCartney, showcased unparalleled creativity, thought-provoking lyrics, and infectious melodies. The band's experimentation with studio techniques and innovative production methods pushed the boundaries of what was possible in popular music. With their timeless hits, such as "Hey Jude," "Let It Be," and "Yesterday," The Beatles transformed the landscape of music and continue to inspire generations of musicians and fans alike. Celebrate the legacy of The Beatles with this collection of vocabulary coming from some of their most famous albums.

Title: A Few Red Drops
Description: This book, which won the Coretta Scott King Award in 2019, traces the history of racial tension that led to the Chicago Race Riot of 1919.
Author: Claire Hartfield

Title: Warriors Don't Cry
Subtitle: A Searing Memoir of the Battle to Integrate Little Rock's Central High
Description: In 1957, Melba Pattillo was one of a group of teenagers who integrated Central High School in Little Rock, Arkansas. In this memoir, she describes her fight to survive and thrive in the sometimes violent aftermath of the Supreme Court decision that declared segregation unconstitutional.
Author: Melba Pattillo Beals

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: September 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Inherit the Wind
Description: Based on real-life events, this courtroom drama explores what happens when a Tennessee schoolteacher is put on trial for teaching evolution.
Author: Jerome Lawrence

Title: Lost Boy, Lost Girl
Description: In this memoir, Jon Bul Dau and Martha Arual Akech describe growing up during the civil war in Sudan and their eventual journey to America.
Author: John Bul Dau

Title: Ceremony
Description: Tayo is a World War II veteran and former prisoner of war who struggles to find peace when he returns to the Laguna Pueblo Reservation.
Author: Leslie Marmon Silko

Title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
Description: Fifteen-year-old Christopher John Francis Boone, inspired by Sherlock Holmes, tries to make sense of his life in England in logical and mathematical ways.
Author: Mark Haddon

Title: The Chocolate War
Description: When Jerry refuses to sell chocolates for his school's annual fundraiser, his defiance is seen as a challenge to the school's powerful secret society.
Author: Robert Cormier

Title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
Description: In this classic autobiography, the accomplished poet and writer recounts her childhood and teenage years.
Author: Maya Angelou

Title: Angela's Ashes
Subtitle: A Memoir
Description: After the death of their daughter, Frank McCourt's impoverished immigrant parents decide to return to Ireland. With humor and tenderness, this Pulitzer Prize-winning memoir tells the story of his early life there.
Author: Frank McCourt

Title: All We Have Left
Description: The September 11th attacks on the World Trade Center in New York City impact the lives of two teenagers.
Author: Wendy Mills

Title: The Blithedale Romance
Description: In this novel inspired by his experiences at a utopian commune, Nathaniel Hawthorne describes conflicts within and between intellectuals trying to create a perfect society. Read full text here.
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

Title: Eragon
Description: In the first book of The Inheritance Cycle, a fifteen-year-old boy finds a dragon egg in the woods and becomes a Dragon Rider.
Author: Christopher Paolini

Title: The Portrait of a Lady
Description: An heiress attempts to maintain her independence but is preyed upon by fortune-hunters.
Author: Henry James

Title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
Description: While exploring an unfamiliar house, four siblings discover a portal to the mystical kingdom of Narnia, a perpetually frozen land under the control of a powerful witch.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Title: A Streetcar Named Desire
Description: In this Pulitzer Prize-winning drama, Blanche DuBois, a faded Southern belle, is driven to madness by her brother-in-law Stanley Kowalski.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Title: The Secret School
Description: Fourteen-year-old Ida dreams of becoming a teacher. When her town's one-room schoolhouse must shut down, Ida decides to secretly teach the other students and prepare for her own high school entrance exams.
Author: Avi

Title: The Egypt Game
Description: When Melanie, April, and Marshall discover an abandoned yard, they think it's the perfect place to play games based on their shared love of ancient Egypt. But the children aren't prepared to deal with a creepy antiques dealer, mysterious oracles, and a shocking murder.
Author: Zilpha Keatley Snyder

Title: Felix Ever After
Description: Talented artist Felix Love strives to earn a scholarship to his dream college, while also trying to figure out the identity of the cruel bully who has been targeting him.
Author: Kacen Callender

Title: Falling Short
Description: Californian sixth graders Isaac Castillo and Marco Honeyman describe how their best friendship helps them through their troubles at home and in school.
Author: Ernesto Cisneros

Title: The Cat I Never Named
Subtitle: A True Story of Love, War, and Survival
Description: This memoir recounts how teenage Amra, with the help of a stray cat, survived the Serbian invasion of Bosnia that killed about a hundred thousand people, especially Muslims, from 1992–1995.
Author: Amra Sabic-El-Rayess

Title: The Mysterious Benedict Society
Description: After taking a strange exam, four children are admitted to a secret society and tasked with infiltrating the sinister Learning Institute for the Very Enlightened.
Author: Trenton Lee Stewart

Title: Baseball in April
Subtitle: And Other Stories
Description: This collection of short stories, which draws on the author's own childhood, focuses on Latino and Latina children growing up in California.
Author: Gary Soto

Title: Salt to the Sea
Description: Through the alternating perspectives of four fictional teens, best-selling author Ruta Sepetys dramatizes the experiences of refugees searching for a safe haven during World War II. Learn key vocabulary from this engrossing historical novel based on a true story.
Author: Ruta Sepetys

Title: Be a Perfect Person in Just Three Days!
Description: When Milo comes across a book about achieving perfection, he decides to follow the book's advice — with hilarious results.
Author: Stephen Manes

Title: How to Find What You're Not Looking For
Description: Set in the 1960s, eleven-year-old Ariel Goldberg travels to New York City in hopes of reuniting her family after her older sister Leah elopes with Raj, an Indian immigrant.
Author: Veera Hiranandani

Title: Unwind
Description: In this dystopian novel, sixteen-year-old Connor has been slated to be "unwound" and have his organs donated — until he runs away and joins up with two other fugitive teenagers.
Author: Neal Shusterman

Title: Legal Lingo
Description: In the courtroom of life, lawyers are the ultimate word wizards, sprinkling legal jargon like confetti and turning the dullest contracts into epic tales of justice. With their briefcases full of wit and their arguments as sharp as a pencil, they're the legal superheroes we didn't know we needed — definitely guilty of making the law a whole lot more fun!

Title: Hidden Figures
Subtitle: The American Dream and the Untold Story of the Black Women Mathematicians Who Helped Win the Space Race
Description: A group of extraordinarily talented African-American women help NASA achieve some of its greatest successes, even as they face discrimination and oppression.
Author: Margot Lee Shetterly

Title: Year of Impossible Goodbyes
Description: After suffering under the Japanese occupation of Korea during World War II and the subsequent rule by communist Russia, Sookan and her family attempt a daring escape to South Korea.
Author: Sook Nyul Choi

Title: Kiss Number 8
Description: In this graphic novel, Mads's idyllic life is upended when she must come to terms with a surprising family secret and a crush on her best friend.
Author: Colleen AF Venable

Title: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
Description: Set in New York City at the turn of the twentieth century, Betty Smith's classic coming-of-age novel tells the story of Francie and her Irish-American family.
Author: Betty Smith

Title: American Born Chinese
Description: Through three interlinked stories, this award-winning graphic novel explores assimilation, racism, and stereotypes.
Author: Gene Luen Yang

Title: Surviving Hitler
Subtitle: A Boy in the Nazi Death Camps
Description: This nonfiction narrative tells the story Jack Mandelbaum, who was imprisoned in Nazi-led concentration camps during World War II.
Author: Andrea Warren
